string-array.name: top_tips
string-array.item: "You can only see files to select for upload that are acceptable to upload on your server. If you wish to upload videos, be sure to alter your server config.inc.php file to include $conf['upload_form_all_types'] = true; rather than false"
If an upload just won\'t succeed, try using the preference in the app settings upload page to clear any residual failed uploads from the server
Error always occurs when trying to update tags - \"You are not allowed to delete tags\" - Ensure users can both add and delete tags (server plugin setting)
Share files from a different app with this app to add them to the upload screen ready to go to your current server
Long click on an image (either thumbnail or slideshow item) that has failed to load in order to retrieve it again
Long click on an album to delete that album and all content
Long click on an album image to enable bulk selection of images for an action
When viewing any image in the slideshow, long click to rotate / change image size shown / allow further zooming
You can zoom into an image when viewing in a slideshow by drawing two fingers together or apart on the screen
When logged in as an administrator, before handing your device to a friend to view your photos, engage the application lock feature to prevent inadvertent changes being made to your gallery
Once you have viewed an entire video, if local file caching is enabled, it is possible to save that video to your downloads folder
Long click delete button on a \'file for upload\' to delete all files to be uploaded (when job is not in progress)

string-array.name: planned_releases
string-array.item: "Changes: - Possibly: - Removal of all or most adverts in favour of a free trial period followed by a subscription based payment model - Auto image rotation based on device orientation, device orientation, device orientation ignoring screen rotation lock - Verify the current login status to ensure album and image lists are always correct - Verify support for upload to older servers (e.g. piwigo.com - version 2.8a) - Allow linking the upload process to a compression routine for videos - The ability to delete an album, but not its contents (creating orphans) - Orphan file management - Allow user to zoom out in slideshow (view smaller than fullscreen) - Investigate adding support for coloured tag plugin - Remember the previously opened photo or album when the user opens the app. - Support stretching or cropping images to fill device screen - Add some sort of help to assist user in knowing the features - Improved Animated gif support - Possibly (Paid App only): - The random photos idea implemented on the piwigo web UI - Support for user comments - Notify user of server updates that are available - Support for editing EXIF and other image metadata formats - Add preference to allow showing/hiding the EXIF etc fields of or not of interest - Screen cast of some kind to allow mirror of device on a larger screen - Anything Else: - Please email me (there is an email link in the navigation bar) to request things you need or want that this app doesn't yet do"

string-array.name: release_history
string-array.item: "Bugfix: - Crash when marking image as a Favorite - Crash when using date sort order with folder containing a brand new unused folder"
"Changes: - Better management of view model data"
"Changes: - Support for sorting child albums by name, last updated date, or the default server order"
"Changes: - Slideshow order now reflects the album sort order when reversed - slideshow item cache size reduced to reduce change of crash on app minimise"

"Changes: - Addition of optional pre-upload (non configurable presently) video compression of all mp4 videos (16:9 format only) - Filtering of file types enabled in file selection window - You can now click on the app icon in the navigation bar to refresh the user login - Added preference to allow inverting the album photo sort order - Allow hiding and showing of sub albums within an album (click albums heading) Bugfix: - Multiple glitches in the upload process"
